unnormalised: A Delhi man's house has become a local landmark, not for its architectural brilliance, but for its sheer descriptive address. Forget Google Maps; you need a short story to find this place. It seems 123/4A, Gali No. 5, Behind the Big Banyan Tree (the one with the swing!), Near the Old Shiv Mandir (not the new one!), Opposite Sharma Ji’s Mithai Shop (the one that always smells like jalebi), Phase 2, Shastri Nagar, Delhi, 110031 is quite the mouthful.
normalised: A Delhi man's house has become a local landmark, not for its architectural brilliance, but for its sheer descriptive address. Forget Google Maps; you need a short story to find this place. It seems one hundred and twenty three slash four A, Gali number five, Behind the Big Banyan Tree (the one with the swing!), Near the Old Shiv Mandir (not the new one!), Opposite Sharma Ji's Mithai Shop (the one that always smells like jalebi), Phase two, Shastri Nagar, Delhi, one one zero zero three one is quite the mouthful.

unnormalised: Neighbors claim delivering pizza there is an Olympic sport. One delivery guy reportedly said, "I spent 45 minutes trying to locate 'the Big Banyan Tree with the swing!' Turns out Sharma Ji was giving me directions the whole time, selling me sweets, and *then* pointing me across the street. My GPS gave up after 'Gali No. 5.'"
normalised: Neighbors claim delivering pizza there is an Olympic sport. One delivery guy reportedly said, "I spent forty five minutes trying to locate 'the Big Banyan Tree with the swing!' Turns out Sharma Ji was giving me directions the whole time, selling me sweets, and *then* pointing me across the street. My G-P-S gave up after 'Gali number five.'"

unnormalised: The homeowner, identified only as Mr. Gupta (probably because his full address is too long to fit on a driver’s license), is reportedly considering a simpler option: renaming his house “Jalebi Junction.” Or perhaps even shorter: "Sharmaji's Opposite."
normalised: The homeowner, identified only as Mister Gupta (probably because his full address is too long to fit on a driver’s license), is reportedly considering a simpler option: renaming his house “Jalebi Junction.” Or perhaps even shorter: "Sharmaji's Opposite."

unnormalised: Local postmen are rumored to carry a pre-printed map titled "The Gupta Labyrinth," alongside their usual route maps. Finding 123/4A, Gali No. 5 is apparently a rite of passage. New recruits are sent there as their final exam.
normalised: Local postmen are rumored to carry a pre-printed map titled "The Gupta Labyrinth," alongside their usual route maps. Finding one hundred and twenty three slash four A, Gali number five is apparently a rite of passage. New recruits are sent there as their final exam.

unnormalised: In a related story, Sharma Ji's mithai sales have skyrocketed. He's considering changing the name of his shop to "Sharma Ji's, Next to Gupta's Really, Really, Really Complicated Address." It’s a win-win, except maybe for the pizza delivery guys.
normalised: In a related story, Sharma Ji's mithai sales have skyrocketed. He's considering changing the name of his shop to "Sharma Ji's, Next to Gupta's Really, Really, Really Complicated Address." It’s a win-win, except maybe for the pizza delivery guys.
